main event: A round, white object larger than a star was observed slowly descending in Hoctor, Arkansas on 5 December 1957.
interesting points: The object changed color from white to a reddish or orange glow before becoming invisible., The sighting lasted approximately 20 minutes., The object was reported as being larger than a star and distinct from other visible lights., It was suggested that the object may have had explosive material causing the color change., The observer's identity was noted as Sidney Dortch.
